text: [5/14/17] Can in the line for Bokkereyder release at Mikkeller & Friends Bottle Shop in Copenhagen. Nice fruity hops, moderately bitter. Very nice.
Cloudy peach pour with a white head. Tropical fruits with hints of citrus and pine, a little sweet, flavourful, slightly dank and grassy finish.
At the line to Bokkereyder, pours yellow with a small head, aroma of lemon, pineapple, pine, flavor of herbs, pine, lemon skin, medium bodied

Pint can from Craft Beer Cellar in Belmont, MA. Classic NE IPA appearance, which I still cant really get onboard with. Yellow-orange, hazy as hell, large and messy white head. The aroma is awesome, lots of citrus and tropical fruits - grapefruit, peach, pineapple, mango juice - as well as pine and floral notes. The flavor is earthy, rindy, and hoppy, but quite smooth. Very juicy and dry with just a hint of sweetness. Excellent feel, rough and well carbonated. One of the best NE IPAs Ive ever had.

Draft at taproom. Pours pineapple yellow with a white head. A fair amount of lacing Coates the glass. A fair amount of citrus and pine on the nose. Nice hop
Bitterness on the tongue along with the citrus and grass notes. Fairly finished clean. Nice!

Can at The Local Pub, Athen. Pours hazy deep golden with a small creamy white head. Aroma of massive piney hops, also some pineapple and fresh citrus. Taste is also massive pine, loaded with crispy grapefruit, tropical fruit juice, heavy carbonated, but as long as it is that good, ok for me.

Canette datée du 07/03/2017, bue après 5 semaines. Robe jaunâtre trouble à lapparence juteuse et avec un mince col de mousse blanc. Arômes de cocktail dagrumes, ananas, malt épais, légère résine, quelques fruits tropicaux. Nez intense. En bouche, beaucoup dagrumes, sucres de fruits tropicaux, résine de pin liquoreuse et un fort goût dananas arrive par la suite. Finale sur le grain malté ainsi quun peu de pamplemousse. Texture légère et huileuse, corps mince à moyen.
Pours clear golden. Herbal hops, nice straightforward bitterness. Clean pine-needles and great balance. Fruity and juicy. Very quaffable indeed.

Pours a hazy, pale yellow-orange, with mid-sized head. Aroma of citrus, tropical fruit, and piney hops. Flavor is citrusy (grapefruit), with dank, bitter, piney hops. Pillowy mouthfeel. Bitter finish. Really good beer on the whole.

Aroma of grapefruit, pine, mango. Taste of mango, passionfruit, with a grassy piney finish. A bit softer and not as extreme as other trillium, shows a bit of restraint, but anyway very nice and drinkable.
Can. Thanks Jon! Lovely tropical fruit aroma, bit of maltiness, minerals. Taste is very nice, juicy, easy drinking, grapefruit, bit of caramel. Nice.
Can. Nose of pine, oranges, mineral. Cloudy orange with lace. Spicy, fruity flavor, estery stone fruit, with a nice peppery finish. Not fresh enough but decent.
Hazy golden amber. Very pithy nose with tons of stonefruit and breadth nose. Super smooth mouth. Not too bitter but decent.

Can, 1 pint. Clearish golden with sediment and a frothy offwhite head. Aromas of tropical hops, resin. Medium bodied, fizzy carbonation. Medium sweet, medium bitter. Deep tropical flavors into a juicy bitter finish.

Can, 1 pint. A golden beer with a medium size white head. Fruity aromas, very tropical. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter. Medium bodied with some carbonation, juicy and very fruity at the end. Reminds me of pineapple and citrics.

Canned 12/15/16. Pours unfiltered particle-y orange golden, white head. Aroma is mostly pine and pineapple. Mango, papaya, clementine, some sugar. Really digging this nose. Flavor is pine, pineapple, grapefruit, clementine, grapefruit rind, floral, tropical notes, juicy. A little overcarbed for me, but the rest of this beer makes up for it. Top notch.
On tap. Pour is hazy golden yellow with a medium white head. Notes of pineapple juice, pine, musk, grapefruit, spice, and biscuit malt.
From a 16 oz. can purchased at the brewery. Pours a clear gold with an off white head. Juicy citrus aromas. Flavors of orange, grapefruit and melon. Yum.

Thanks Drew.
Poured into a becher pint glass, the appearance was a hazy semi-dark burnt orange color with a quickly dissipating fingers worth of white foamy head. Lacing was pretty messy.
The aroma bleeds bitter orange rind up front, bold and has an underlying danky sweet onion and then the bitter pine that exacts its presence upon a bold but zesty/sweet hop bitterness. Also, seems to have a sly sweet wheat in there.
The flavor blends all of the previously mentioned aromas wonderfully: zesty, sweet to bitter, subtle dankiness and the piney bitterness, full. Resinous bitter piney/zesty aftertaste with a quick finish.
On the palate, this one sat about a light to medium on the body with a very nice sessionability about it. Mild carbonation felt fantastic dancing along my tongue between a creamy and bitter texture, weird, but its there.
Overall, what an absolutely fantastic AIPA that I believe gets hyped up as it does because the majority of reviewers are looking for the most complex beers. Yes, this beer has everything going on and still equates to a wonderful version of a brewers creativity and staying within the style.

Can. The pour is a brighter hazy than some of their other offerings. The aroma is big hops as usual, slight spiciness to it. The taste is splendid like most. The hops are not over aggressive. I can be overly critical and say there is a slight muted flavor to it, but that is just silly,
16oz embossed can brought by bananabi11 from a trade, shared by all. Thanks! That unclear pale orange east coast pour. Sweet almost simcoe-y. Slightly fruity. Some malt presence. Tasty stuff! 14.2

Thank you Mathieu87 + PriorL for the effort! Can sampled @ Samson en Geert Bierproef Avond. Canned 02 NOV 2016. Lightly hazy orange with little head. Far less hazy than usual from Trillium. Nose is massively dank hop with huge orange, grapefruit, near tropical. Taste is raw dank weeds, orange hop, mellow mandarine peel, easy drinking, quite a bit of bitter tangerine & the likes peel. Thick orange peel, hop puree body. Quite a solid & very nice beer.

Aroma - is a composite of citrus: lemon, peach, mango, and starfruit, floral, and herbal hops. Underlying caramel malt.
Appearance - the body is a clean amber, with 2" of white head. There is some scattered lacing.
Taste - has a big juicy citrus hop nature. The citrus hops include elements of peach, lemon, mango, guava, and some starfruit. There is also some floral, herbal, and subtle pungent hops. The bedrock includes a caramel natured malt.
Palate - medium body, velvety texture, carbonation is average, the finish is juicy and slightly bitter.

can recieved in a trade, poured hazy deep dark golden with a white head. nose of grass hops, grapefruit, malt, citrus notes, passion fruits, papaya, and light resinous pine notes. dry pine aftertaste, sweet tropical fruits, crisp malts mouthfeel.

Can care of Michael, thanks dude, this one has eluded me for some reason. Pours an ultra hazy orange with medium loose fitting white head. Smell is guava, passionfruit, tangerine, peach pie, skunk and dank grapefruit. Smell is a 10/10. The flavor is not nearly as impressive (6/10), theres some pine, resinous and slightly sugary orange and heavy booze. Really surprised it has this much alcohol bite at 7.2 but that is a little big for my tastes these days. The heat didnt fade as I continued to drink it. Medium bodied. They got the scent down but fell short hiding the booze.

Hazy orange color with off-white head. Aroma is quite peachy with nice fruity notes and some dank hops in the back. Taste starts slightly sweet and fruity with ripe tropical fruits and some grassy bitterness on the finish. Medium body and carbonation. Another good one from Trillium.

Draft pour at the Shelton Brothers Festival. Pours a hazy pale gold with a big white head that settles into a thin film and ring. Notes of herbs, lemon, grass, pale and bready malts, and mellow tropical fruits - mango, melon, peach. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and a pretty clean mouthfeel overall, but one that doesnt completely sacrifice bitterness. Finishes dry. So it doesnt quite explode like the double dry-hopped version, but so what. This is delightful in its own right.
A: Hazy orange/light brown coloured with a huge white head N: Pine, grapefruit, passionfruit, mango T: Mango, pine, papaya O: Very fruity hop juice.
Pours murky orange with no head. Resin, laundry detergent, pine. Medium sweetness, medium bitterness.

16oz can (CANS!) pours a muddy orange with some frothy, white head. Nose is grassy, mild pepper and pine, orange, mild tangerine. Flavor is orange soda, soap, herbs, pepper, a little paper, lemon. Finishes bitter and peppery.

Got in a BIF from oline73. 16 ounce can into signature tulip glass, canned on 9/15/2016. Pours moderately hazy/cloudy golden orange color with a 1-2 finger dense and fluffy white head with good retention, that reduces to a small cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings around the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange zest, berry, light pepper/pine, honey, light caramel, wheat, biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of juicy citrus/tropical hops and moderate bready malt notes; with great strength. Taste of huge grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange zest, berry, light pepper/pine, honey, light caramel, wheat, biscuit, herbal, and floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate pine/grassy/citrus peel bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, passion fruit, papaya, mango, melon, lemon/orange zest, berry, pepper, pine, honey, light caramel, wheat, biscuit, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical hops and moderate bready malt flavors; with an amazing malt/bitterness balance, and zero lingering hop astringency after the finish. Light dryness from bitterness, increasing through the glass. Medium carbonation and body; with a very smooth, moderately creamy/bready/sticky, and slightly resinous balanced mouthfeel that is incredible. Zero warming alcohol for 7.2%. Overall this is an insane IPA! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of juicy citrus/tropical hops and moderate bready malt flavors; very smooth and easy to drink with the modest bitterness. A highly amazing offering.

Tasted on 10/19/16 from a 16oz can, big thanks to Alex. Pours lightly hazy, but still bright orange, with a thick white head that slowly recedes to rocky lace. The nose is bright, floral passion fruit, a touch under ripe mango, some tart orange juice, and pineapple candy, with a light green grape hint. The flavor is a bit more pineapple with a lightly earthy, hint of bitter grassy note, but still lots of passion fruit and other tropical fruit. The body is medium with almost lively carbonation, and a very long passion fruit driven, with a hint of herbal bitter finish.
Can shared with the DB guys. Hazy dark golden pour with a generous head. Notes of tropical fruits, mangoes, pineapple, and oranges. Light bitterness and tons og juiciness!

500mL can, sent from wilco (thanks a lot, Mike), pours an opaque cloudy bright orange with a small white head. Nose brings out vibrant tropical fruits, some stone fruits, and piney hops. Flavour is so fresh and juicy, with tons of tropical fruits (mangos and papayas especially), resinous hops, and just enough chewy caramel malt backing to hold this together. So fresh and juicy, with incredible depth. Phenomenal IPA.

Can from dbarnold, dated 9/15/16, received yesterday. Thanks Dave, even though you wont read this since you never rate anymore! Pours a murky orange color with an off-white head and drippy lacing. Big fruity hop aroma. Mango, peach, and orange juice. Pine and some catty notes as well, underneath the fruity hops. Fruit forward flavor, maybe a touch too sweet, but still delicious. Hints of spice, the pine/catty hops, and some light bitterness come through later on the palate. Way too crushable for a 7.2% beer. Medium bodied. I understand why people love to knock these beers, I really do. If you are looking for something that can hold up for months and show off beautiful subtlety, this probably isnt the beer for that. If you are looking for a delicious hop-forward, low bitterness beer to drink fresh, than this is gonna be the shit for you. Hops off soap box. Not sure why I felt the need to go off on that rant in this review, but Im leaving it in here. Anyway, I liked this quite a bit, and I could drink a lot of it.
16 ounce shared can. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a nice white head. Aroma of citrus, pine, and tropical. Taste is grapefruit, pineapple, orange, tropical, pine, and malt. Excellent.

16 oz can to pint (shared with the Mrs.). Looks good; a cloudy, juice-like mango with foamy eggshell head. Smells and tastes orange-forward with a mildly to moderately bittersweet backbone and a touch of biscuit on the finish. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied and juicy. Not one of my favorites from Trillium, but still damn good beer and a nice example of the style.
Pours a light golden orange with a thick white head. Aroma of grapefruit and pine, freshly milled grain and a touch of sweet malt. Taste follows, bitter and dry

This in a can was just as good as I remember the DDH version being in a 750. Barely squeezing in a 4.4 will get this in my top few iPas. 
Big nose as expected - fresh grapefruit and tropicals and pine with low bitterness and a soft palate. Great.

(Cannette provenant de la brasserie): Immensément machable et juteux avec une vague de fruits comme le melon miel, la mangue et la cerise de terre qui précède un volet plus floral et terreux, végétal même. La texture est terriblement glissante, évasive avec laide de la fine carbonatation.

Bottle shared @ Warpigs. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is dank with lots of planty hops. Lemon zest, Quite herby and juicy AF with peach and unripe pineapple. The taste is dank and bitter with citrussy notes. Very juicy and dank but more bitter than expected. Amazing beer!

Can. Pours a cloudy light orange with a lacy off white head. Aroma of pine, exotic fruits, grapefruit, mango, peach. Taste is of grapefruit, orange, peach, exotic fruits, very fruity. Soft chewy oily mouthfeel, medium carbonation.

Canette 473ml, gracieuseté de msjpearson, Thanks Mike! Couleur jaune-orangée trouble, mousse blanche, particules en suspension. Arôme de pomélo, houblon résineux, herbes fraîchement coupées, un peu doignon. Goût de houblon résineux, pomélo, malt, amertume moyenne-élevée, zeste de pomélo. Carbonatation moyenne-élevée, corps moyen-dense. Ça se boit vraiment tout seul.

Really lovely juicy stuff .. Thick orange juice .. Awesome foam party .. Pure hops and sap .. Well played Sharon .. . Refined and rejuvenating .. Just good beer .. . . I will survive the beating of muffins

UPDATED: AUG 19, 2016 473ml can, huge thanks to Jan! Pours cloudy yellowish with a small white head. Aroma of super juicy fruits, citrus, zesty grapefruit, lemon, tropical notes and mango. Taste is super juicy fruity, massively hoppy and grassy with some pine, mango, citrus, tropical notes and apricot. Finish is super juicy fruity, fresh, hoppy and citrusy with some grapefruit, mango, pine, resin and mango. Awesome, super juicy and fruity.
Hazy pale orange pour, larger puffy head. Dank aroma, citrus, a bit of weed. Taste is bitter citrus, resin, melon, grapefruit rind, sweet malt. Medium body.

Appearance: opaque pale amber with one fat finger of creamy ivory head, moderate retention and patchy lacing. (4/5) Aroma: resiny dank pine, grapefruit zest, biscuity pale malt, mango and stone fruit, very light cattiness. (9/10) Taste: moderate sweet, moderate bitter. (8/10) Medium body, moderate carbonation, off-dry slightly sticky and mildly warming finish. (4/5)

A very nice example of Mosaic hopping, with a somewhat danker, less juicy aroma than the Congress Street. Still getting citrus, but its more grapefruit rind and less juicy orange. Theres also a little stone or tropical fruit in there, but theres also just a hint of that cattiness you sometimes get with Mosaic, although its not overwhelming or off-putting at all. Overall it suffers just a little by comparison to Congress Street. Still an excellent A/IPA, mind you, and highly enjoyable. (17/20)

Four pack from the brewery in Canton. Pours out a hazy light orange color. Thin off white head. Bright fresh fruity aromas and flavors. Some pine some spice. Slightly fizzy mouthfeel. Dry bready bitter finish. Much better than Congress Street. Still not stellar but OK.

Can shared at the meeting. 
Slightly hazy deep yellow color with a decent white head. Big tropical fruity citrus and pine with some sweet bready malt under there somewhere. Pretty tasty beer, thanks Bob!

Can shared with Ben during my lunch break, thanks Ben for sharing! Aroma: Nice aroma of peaches, oranges, tropical fruits. Peaches is really whats forward here. App: really hazy orange / peach, small white head, not much lacing. Taste and palate: light to medium body, moderate carbonation, juicy like a lot!, light bitterness. Overall: what an amazing beer! This beer has pretty much exactly what Im looking for in an IPA: extremely fruity aroma, juicy mouthfeel, not too bitter and in CAN! Unfortunately I didnt drink it in can since we shared it but I will sure get some for me eventually and drink them in cans.Thanks again Ben for sharing, much appreciated.

Hazy, orange body with a frothy white collar. Aromas of resinous hops, melon, grapefruit zest. The flavor imparts some stone fruit along with more melon and ripe citrus. Hop forward and delicious, as is customary with Trillium. Another winner.

Can on 7/2/16. Pours super murky orange with a white head. Nose is huge juicy hops, tropical fruit, mango, grass, pine. Taste is juicy NE IPA, pine, tropical fruit, grapefruit bitter, grass. Really tasty.
Bottle split with friends. Juicy and hazy, like all of the best NE IPAs, but this one has a world-class combination of tropical aroma and orange juice taste.
Shred bottle. Has that hazy gold pour with white head. Nose is mango, hops, pine. Tastes floral, with mango notes, some papaya, hops, florals. Smooth finish.

On draft at Trillium Canton. The pour is a foggy golden orange, but doesnt pour juice like like I was expecting. The aroma is full of a bright and dank hop. Lots of Amarillo here, which is a bummer. There is a light juiciness and a pretty hefty bitterness. I am not a fan of the Amarillo hop. Damn. The flavor is a bit better. There is more of a juice to fight the dank, but its still lacking behind some of the other offerings. Its bright and dank Amarillo is a bit of a turn off. The mouth feel is good. Its light and crisp with a softer carbonation that helps it stuck around and last. The aftertaste is lingering hop and citrus zest with a dank hop. Not bad.

Sample at Trillium Canton with koleminer20. Aroma is wonderful, juicy, dank, tropical fruit, citrus, my god. Appearance is golden, hazy, white head. Taste is citrus, dank, some tropical fruit, resin, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, total pine bitter aftertaste taking over. Overall, real good.

75cl bottle. Medium off-white head atop hazy apple juice body. Aroma is moderately sweet, dank/pineapple, light grapefruit. Taste is moderately sweet, grapefruit/pineapple, some dank, light peach. Medium body, some resin, light effervescence.

Bomber. Hazy gold with a foamy off white head that lasts and laces. Aromas pineapple, mango, tangerine, yeast, grain, light musty and spice notes. Flavor is the same. Medium bodied, smooth, chewy and dry.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2017 Bottle into a snifter showing cloudy neon yellow with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows a lot of pineapple and juicy citrus. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated. Flavors of dry pineapple with light citrus. Nice pineapple juiciness on the finish. Barely any bitterness. Dry and fantastic.

From the 650 ml. bottle. The pour is a typical looking cloudy, hazy straw yellow under a big, lingering white head. The aromas are really in your face with an assertive grapefruit, tropical, fruit, and pine character. But toasted malts introduce themselves in a more conservative, laid back fashion. Medium body and very smooth. While the aroma is mostly about the hops, the taste brings out a notable sweet grainy and toasted bread character with the hops keeping a slightly lower profile. Oh, there are there but not as aggressive in the taste. Mild bitterness to finish. This has every reason to be in RBs Top 50 IPAs. It is delightful.

How: Draught.
Where: Omnipollos hatt, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Tropical fruit, pineapple, mango, pine, citrus.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.,
Flavour: Fruit, mango, citrus, grapefruit, pine.

Dank and funky nose with sweet and juicy pineapple. Taste is subtlely sweet at first with bitter earthiness to follow. Defintiely get some more fruity sweetness in the back of the tongue, grapefruit, pineapple. Pretty gentle on the palate overall. Super well balanced and drinkable but complex.

UPDATED: OCT 3, 2016 Bottle shared @ Warpigs. Pours dank hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of dank hops, melon, citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, mosaic herbal sorta notes. Damn this smells good. Taste is bitter, dank, citrussy, melony, grapefruit, tangerines, tropical fruits.
32oz growler->tulip, shared by GenDV110+OT, thanks Donnie!! Murky gold with bare white head. A: juicy citrus hops. T" citrus hops, tropical fruit, nice floral hop bite. Fantastic.

32 oz growler from Trilliums Canton location shared with DCLawyer and my friend Tyler. Filled on 4/21/2016, consumed on 4/27/2016. Slightly hazy golden orange with off-white head. Aromas of tropical fruit, citrus, garlic/onion, light floral notes. Tastes of juicy tropical fruit, citrus, floral notes. Medium body with a dry finish. Juicy mouthfeel. Fantastic stuff.

750 ml bottle purchased from the Canton location. Pours a cloudy unfiltered gold with a large white head. Aroma of freshly squeezed grapefruit, bitter hops, mango and pine. Taste of juicy grapefruit, bitter hops, mango, melon and peach. Another gem from Trillium.
Hazy orange with small white head. Aroma floral, grassy, herbal, citrus. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel. Intense but not harsh hoppy flavors, mostly citrus and pine. Some malt.. Excellent.
Overall: Grapefruit*2.Note: On-tap at Omnipollos hatt. Reviewed 2016-04-12.

Keg at Omnipollos Hatt, Stockholm.  Cloudy deep golden, creamy head. Fruity mango aroma. Sweetish with solid body and rounded mouthfeel. Mango and passionfruit, some hay and saccharine. Peppery bitter finish where chemical saccharine lingers. Nice hops, so-so beer.

Pours milky golden with low white head
Aromas of tropical fruityness dominates the nose
Taste has very nice notes of tropical fruit juice, hints of caramel, vanilla, lactose, light malty
Medium bodied, low bitterness, medium to high sweetness. Very nice!

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Originally reviewed 4/6/2015.
Hazy orange body. Medium white head. Nice lacing.
Herbal and piney. Like a really herbal Nelson hop. Sweet pale malts and some pilsner malts.

Taste is pine, grassy hops. Grapefruit. Tastes like nelson here, too. Pretty sweet. Strong pilsner malt flavor.

Medium body. Medium carbonation.
Good, but a bit of a disappointment compared to other Trillium stuff. Edit: I love reviewing a beer and describing flavors like nelson hops and pilsner malt and then finding out that neither of those two ingredients are present in the beer!

April 10, 2016. On tap at Omnipollos Hatt. 
Cloudy yellow with a small creamy white head. Aroma is sweet juicy and fruity with orange marmalade, sweet pineapple, mango, grapefruit, light onion notes and touch of pine. Taste is medium sweet, fruity and soft bitter. Finish sweet fruity, slight sticky sugary orange marmalade, mango, soft bitter zesty citrus and pine notes, some chive notes. Medium bodied, slight sticky finish, soft to average carbonation. 
Good!

Bouteille de 75cl de et partagée avec Tderoeck.
Dorée sur un voilé trouble assez prononcé, comme souvent avec Trillium, léger col blanc.
Arôme est super houblonné entre sève de sapin, épine, foret, huileux avec pas mal de note de pin en dominant et un rétro agrumes.
Palais est immense qu niveau des houblons, le belles notes de pin, amertume assez sèche avec pas mal dhuileux en fin de buche, et pointe épicée.

Tap at Omnipollos Hatt. Bright, hazy yellow with white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, orange marmalade, slighty floral. Bright flavors that compliment each other perfectly. Slightly zingy lime zest finish. Lovely.

Poured from bottle purchased at Redstone bright hazy yellow with a nice thick white head. Aromas of juicy orange jam light floral notes and dank scallion. Taste is sweet and smooth juicy fruit forward with a balanced finish. Wow.
Bottle shared by Dan. Nose is straight marmalade, juicy. Taste is initially juicy, very orange. Lots of mosaic maybe? Dry finish. Pretty solid.

Bottle share. Poured a bright yellow, bit hazy, and a thick foamy white head. Aroma came through as hop forward with pine, grass, dank, and some citrus and tropical hints. Flavor was similar to the nose and dank pine, onion, grapefruit zest, and some peach. Medium body, sticky texture, bubbly carbonation, and a bitter pine finish. Not as fruity as other Trillium Ive had, but still amazingly good.

Growler (32 oz). Split 4-ways. From Brian and thanks to JulienHuxley for the trade! Clear bright golden with a medium easy to revive white head leaving little lacing. Aroma is super dank and garlicky with tropical fruits and citrus. Taste is juicy and tropical fruits forward with garlic notes - much less than in aroma - onions, a subtle but efficient malt backbone and moderate bitterness. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Moderately oily mouthfeel and a bit creamy as well. Dry finish. Dank. Just a notch under DDH Melcher but a fantastic IPA nonetheless. Really nice dank hops actions. Great!

Growler.
Pours hazy golden with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of citrus, garlic, tropical fruits. Taste is of citrus, tropical fruits, bitterness. Palate: Medium body. Medium-full bodied. Overall: Very nice. Clean. Awesome.

growler shared by tom10101, many thanks! clear light gold with a small white cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. fruity and tropical mosaic, onions, fruit salad juices, flowers, garlic flowers, doughy grapey and peary maltiness, clean yeast. moderate carbonation, light to medium body - oily; balanced and smooth citrusy finish. very solid and juicy ipa. excellent.

Growler shared. Hazy gold pour with thin white head. Aroma is really dank, fabulous garlicky notes, really dank, classic juicy dank trillium hoppiness. Taste is bitter, grapefruit, creamsicle, orange juice, light garlic. Palate is creamy, med bodied, soft creamy carbonation.Really good.

Pours cloudy dull orange with creamy head. Intense citrus aroma carries into taste. Grapefruit and tropical fruit with piney resinous hop finish. Meidum body with smooth, slightly creamy mouthfeel. Wow .. incredible.

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2016 The beer is a medium yellow gold. Its very cloudy, not quite opaque but veyr close. The head is big and white. A thick blanket of bubbles that leaves lacing all over the glass in big globs. The aroma is sweet tangerine, apricot, peach, some grapefruit and a zingy lime edge. Juicy and sweet. Very light simple malt sweetness. The taste is all sweet hop fruitiness. Bitterness is quite mild, just a touch of grapefruit skin in the finish. Light feel with some creaminess to it. Very easy to drink. 

Edit: Can.  Im really enjoying the hop flavors more than before.  Upping my score.

20/XI/15 - 75cl bottle from a trade @ home - BB: n/a, bottled: IX/5/15 (2015-1637) Thanks to Chris for the trade and Thomas for muling!
Cloudy bright orange beer, big creamy yellow head, very stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots of fruit, exotic fruits, some curry, spicy, dry, bit piny. MF: ok carbon, medium to full body. Taste: spicy, fruity, bit sweet, citrus, pineapple, more fruit, little resinous. Aftertaste: very fruity, citrus, bit resinous, pineapple, very nice!
Bottle at tderoeck's place. Hoppy, exotic fruits (as always with Trillium), light spices, very fruity. Awesome stuff.

Bottle at home with my Dad. Pour is murky orange with a big white head and sticky lacing. Mangoes, some pineapple, grassy, light oranges, biscuit, and cracker malt in the aroma. Taste is papaya, grapefruit skins, some guava, grassy, herbal hoppy and bready with with a big bitter finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Solid IPA, though I wish it had a little less bitterness on the finish.

Growler. Pours swamp murky yellow with a thin white head that lingers. Orange aroma over mild carbonation. Light mouthfeel. Superior hop complexity with fruity citrus on the front and bitter bite finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: AUG 23, 2016 750mL bottled 7/10/15, drunk 8/4/15.Typical Trillium pour: big, rocky white head shows wonderful retention atop a hazy brass-copper body. This one was a little less hazy, having sat cold for a little longer than usual, but still, the haze never really goes away completely.Very boisterous, somewhat punchy hops in the nose show a wide array of tangerine, ripe peach, ruby red grapefruit and moderate lemon-lime. Pale malts remain in the background adding balance and no alcohol is noted, nor flaws. I was kind of hoping for more of a reserved congress street-like aroma, with some deep, dank, lush citrus and floral notes, but this one is brash, uppity and almost spicy in its presentation. The peachy-tangerine notes are a touch off-putting, but otherwise, its pretty fun, nonetheless.I swear I taste graham cracker-like malts, rather crunchy but not really taking any flavors away from the hops, which are still front and center. Vanilla-tinged honey malts provide balance, as usual, and at first I thought it was going to be a touch too sweet, but it never built up and actually worked well balancing all of this rather bitter, acidic lemon and grapefruit. Tangy peach, ripe tangerine and the eventual watermelon-like sweetness, with warming. Good and drinkable, like all Trillium pale ales, but just a bit too much twangy/punchy brashness. Dunno, maybe I should have let it sit in the fridge longer....8/5/7/3/14Canned 8/5/16.Huge mosaic aroma, but like their other mosaic-heavy beers, its big on the mushy nectarine-peach.  Theres some pine, but I think the sweet malts mix a bit too much with the hops to dampen the brightness, somewhat.  That being said, I dont find any punchy-twang that I did in the bottled batch above, and that one was almost 2 weeks older than this.  So a solid aroma, for sure, though not the usual deep intensity of other Trilliums.And the beer itself I find just a tad bit too sweet.  Granted its rich, lovely honey maltiness, but I think mosaic is better suited to more dry beers.  Still, this is fantastically easy, flavorful drinking.  Score is for this incarnation.

Bottle thanks to Team Boston. Pours a hazy gold with medium creamy white head that lasts. The aroma is strong pineapple, mango, grapefruit, pine. Medium mouth, tropical fruit, juicy, light bitter pine, very nice.
Hazy deep gold pour, big foamy white head. Aroma of pine, orange, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, spice. Flavor is super bitter, woodey, piney, notes of citrus, lime, crackers and caramel. Awesome.

Bottle. Pours a hazed orange with a large white head. Big spicy citrus on the nose, musk, melon. Medium bodied, citrus, musk, nice yeast with a touch of spice. Lingering spicy yeast, musk, and soft grapefruit bitterness. Lovely stuff.

Thanks to Rian for sharing. Fresh floral nose. The beer starts fresh and smooth, quite dry but nice hop profile. Fresh, pine, hints of malt. Not too
much bitterness, fresh, malty-dry finish with piney hints. Nice but not too intense :)

Hazy straw-orange body, medium to large sized white head, and soapy lacing. Intense grapefruit rind, mango, pineapple, melon, pine, and resin. Light crackery malts come through here and there. Medium bodied with moderate to soft carbonation, lively, refreshing bitterness, nice dryness throughout.

Thanks Rob and Jason. Pours a hazy golden wheat color with a large of white head. The smell is juicy citrus, bright and crisp. The Tate is grapefruit, dry and crisp.. Delicious. Light+ body with right crisp carbonation.

750 ml bottle dated 05/02/15 supplied by Willrunforbeer, this is how you follow up Hill Farmstead, wow! Bright hazy gold with great spotty head retention. Good lord that is a ton of onion, scallion and danky weed like notes. 
The flavor mimics the aroma and is A metric fuck ton of Mosaic hops with the addition of traces of pine, grass and some tropical fruit. The carbonation and mouthfeel is soft and gentle. Bitterness is on the lower side with the malt sitting in the back seat and hops all upfront. The Mosaic is alive and kicking, awesome.
750mL picked up at Redstone. Dated 05/02. Pours orange gold with a white head. Aroma is mango, grapefruit, mild scallion. Flavor is mango, lime, grapefruit. Quite nice.

Pour is heavily hazed golden yellow with a deeper amber center and lots of tight white head that lingers for a while. Nose is heavily hopped, citra? Tons of melon rind and tangy citrus, a hint of doughy malt and some nice clean grain. Flavor is again heavily hopped with musky melon rinds and tons of citrus hop. The hops really dominate the flavor, finish is fairly bitter,gets slightly harsh, lingers for a moment through the finish. Lighter bodied and nicely carbonated, slightly grainy in the finish.

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2016 Bottle thanks to Brian! Pours quite hazy orange, large creamy off-white head, dissipates slowly, nice lacing. Aroma is dank and sweaty, spruce and sex. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, again dank, steamy sweaty, dark rooms and hopeful groping. Lightish body. Really really good.

Pours from bottle into a tulip: Pours golden yellow with a one finger head. Aroma is resin, pineapply, mango, and grapefruit. Taste is pine up front, followed by sweeter pineapple and grapefruit, and a nice hop bite in the finish. Medium body,slightly sticky mouthfeel, fantastic IPA.

UPDATED: MAR 2, 2015 Bottle from trade. Huge thanks goes out! Pours hazy yellow gold color with a big fluffy white head that sticks around for a good while. Beautiful aroma of pineapples, mango, some dry pine, some grapefruit rind and sweet citrus juice. Flavor is a blast of bitter pine up front alongside big sweet pineapple juice, grapefruit rinds, dryness. A really interesting balance of very bitter and sweet fruit juice. Nicely done here. Medium bodied, resinous but finishing dry, medium low carbonation. Right on.

Aroma: Grapefruit, Veggie, Piney

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw/Orangish Hue, Passes Some Light, Thin White Head Ring, Some Lacing

Taste: Veggie, Grapefruit Rind

Mouthfeel: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying, Mildly Bitter

30th December 20145 Kay, 7.5 Kay, 10 Kay Tasting. Big thanks to Leighton. Lightly hazy pale gold beer, small pale cream colour head. Smooth airy palate. Light herby spicy hop nose. Light smooth airy malt, modest sweetness. Hops start with mild marmalade which leads to herby spicy skunk. Nice tropical fruits which turn to fresh orange. Trace of sherbet and lemon. Light finish with a light hop spice linger. The balance of flavours and drinkability is top notch. This beer also managed to render Theydon_Bois speechless, because is spoke to him and I get that. It didnt quite reach that heady height for me but this is another wonderful beer from Trillium.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy pale orange with a full white head. Aroma of pineapple, grass, light maltiness. Taste is medium bitterness. Medium light palate. Medium carb. Really reminds me of a Three Floyd's IPA, maybe Permanent Funeral?

Bottle (bottled exactly four weeks ago). Pours a hazy pale orange. Aroma is tropical fruit, citrus. Smells delicious. Juicy fruit, mandarin, and some light sweetness in the background to add some balance to the pronounced bitterness that lasts and lasts. Light-to-medium bodied, average carbonation, and a long bitter finish. Solid. This beer has won me over.

Bottle thanks to Leighton. It pours cloudy golden with a medium white head. The nose is soft, bitter-sweet, juicy, peach, apricot, passion fruit, grapefruit, dank grassy action and sherbet. The taste is smooth, soft, fresh, bitter-sweet, toasty, straw, passion fruit, peach, dank, earth, apricot and candied peel with a smooth, fruity finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Unbelievably drinkable. Pretty much drinks itself. Trillium proving once again they are kings of hoppy pale stuff.

Bottle shared at the 5K/10K tasting, big thanks to Leighton, 30/12/14.
Hazed orange golden with a big old off white/egg shell white covering that stays for the show - a looker!
Nose is pine, juicy citric drippings, apricot, skunky hop notes, orange pith, grapefruit.
Taste comprises pine, grapefruit, light spice, citric tinged straw, melon, apricot, fresh and earthy hops.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation - pitch perfect.
Top draw hop juice, world class, IPA #888 on RB and I dont recall any better!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle@ The Other Tasting. Gold with a small head. Nose is huge cut grass, tropical fruits and sprint bloom. Green shoots. Wonderfully dank and fresh

Bottle shared in London - picked up at the brewery last week. Pours hazy gold with a frothy white head. Beautiful aroma, lots of pissy hops, grapefruit, pine needles. Medium sweet flavor with rich dank hop character, pale bread, mango, pine needles, grapefruit. Medium bodied with fine, caressing carbonation. Lightly resinous on the finish, a bit dry and pithy, more pee and grapefruit. Balanced, fresh, juicy, dank. Eminently drinkable.

Super fresh bottle from brewery. Pours a hazy orange yellow, fluffy white head. Aroma is hop resin, dank nugs, grapefruit, fresh cut grass, tangerine. Flavor is gooey dank resin, citrus fruits, grass, light sweet, lasting hop finish. A beauty of an ipa

Very hazy 2 finger white head. Vey creamy. Its a deep orange. Very grapefruit heavy. Loads of tangerine as with with acidic hops.nice clean yeast profile. A bit orange skin / rind forward and a lot of sweetness in the middle and end of the taste
Pours a hazy light orange with a white lacing. The aroma is citrus forward with orange creamscicle.

One of the better IPAs I have had in a while. Huge citrus and resin with clean moderately sweet pale malts. Finishes bitter and lightly sticky. Chewy hops stick around for a while without overstaying its welcome.

On tap at the brewery. Hazy golden pour with a white head. Floral and grapefruit hop aromas. Taste follows suit with some mild citrus undercurrents. Tangy hop bitterness with just enough of a malt backbone to keep it in check. Above average mouthfeel with a god body. Well done..
growler, thanks jared! Wow this is awesome, great hop profile, light to moderate malt profile. I really like it, nicely done.

32oz growler in a tulip. Pours golden with a lacy, white head. Aroma strong of fruity and citrusy and floral hops, some pale and light caramel malts, and light dough. Flavor the same with a lot of fruity and citrusy hops. Average texture. A good IPA.

Growler consumed @ one day old. Juicy sweet tropical fruits. Tangerine. Oranges. Clementines. Bit of pine resin bitterness. Clean. Bit too big for my liking. Bit too much sweetness as it warms. Petes pretty good.

Pours hazy gold into a tulip. White head with little retention recedes to hug rim. Tropical fruit and resin aromas. Well balanced with sweet caramel and tropical fruit upfront turning to pine and resin in the lasting finish.
